etymology.description: 无(無) (wú, "not have") and 法(法) (fǎ, "method") combine to express the concept of lacking a method or way, thus conveying the meaning of being 'unable' or 'without a method'. In this context, 无(無) (wú, "not have") negates the existence of 法(法) (fǎ, "method"), leading to the interpretation.
etymology.interpretation: This combination conveys the idea of being without a method or means to achieve something, hence being unable to do it.

examples.chinese: 我无法解决这个问题(我無法解決這個問題)。
examples.english: I am unable to solve this problem.

examples.chinese: 天气变坏(天氣變壞)，我们无法出门(我們無法出門)。
examples.pinyin: Tiānqì biàn huài, wǒmen wúfǎ chūmén.
examples.english: When the weather turns bad, we are unable to go out.

examples.chinese: 他面对困难时无法动弹(他面對困難時無法動彈)。
examples.pinyin: Tā miànduì kùnnán shí wúfǎ dòngtán.
examples.english: He is unable to move when faced with difficulties.
